info.title: Products
info.description: Provides methods to create and manage subscription products.

oauth2.description:
To use this API, you need to obtain the OAuth client credentials (client ID and secret) using the SAP HANA Cloud Platform cockpit. After that, pass these client credentials to the SAP HANA Cloud Platform token endpoint to obtain an access token.
For more information, see the API Developer Guide.

tags.name: Batch Requests
tags.description: Retrieve, create, update, or delete multiple products.

tags.name: Single Requests
tags.description: Retrieve, create, update, or delete individual products.

subscriptionAspect.description: Attributes specific to a subscription product.

externalReference.description: An identifier that is entered by the user and refers to external information, for example, a product name, a purchase order number, or a cost center.

subscriptionType.description: The type of subscription that governs follow-up processes such as rating and billing.

contractTerm.description: The period during which a customer is contractually bound to hold a subscription, defined in months.

renewalTerm.description: The period by which the subscription extends automatically after the initial contract term, defined in months.

termOfNotice.description: The period of time to be observed if a customer wants to cancel a subscription, defined in days.

allowMidBillCycleExpiration.description: If true, a subscription may expire during an active billing cycle.

market.description: The organizational unit that offers a product, sets the legal framework and reflects various business-relevant attributes including a reference to a sales organization and further aspects, such as currency, language, and time zone.

marketId.description: The unique identifier of the market.

active.description: If true, the market is active and the product can be offered in the respective market.

typeCode.description: The code representing the type of the reference.

createdAt.description: The date and time the product was created.

changedAt.description: The date and time the product was last changed.

id.description: The unique identifier of the product.

code.description: The user-defined identifier of the product.

soldElectronically.description: If true, the product is sold electronically.

published.description: If true, the product is published and available for further processing.

productType.description: The type of the product, for example, a subscription product.

version.description: The version of the product, used for optimitic locking.

code.description: The user-defined identifier of the product.

soldElectronically.description: If true, the product is sold electronically.

published.description: If true, the product is published and available for further processing.

productType.description: The type of the product, for example, a subscription product.

status.description: Original HTTP error code. It should be consistent with the response HTTP code.

type.description: Classification of the error type. Lower case with underscore, for example, validation_failure.

details.description: List of problems causing this error.

field.description: A bean notation expression specifying the element in request data causing the error, for example, product.variants[3].name.This can be empty if violation was not field specific.

type.description: Classification of the error detail type. Lower case with underscore, for example, missing_value. This value must be always interpreted in context of the general error type.

message.description: Descriptive error detail message for debugging.

technicalResource.description: An ID or reference that identifies a subscriber and the subscribed service in an external technical system. Technical resources are used to record the usage of a service.

type.description: The identifier of the technical resource.

idType.description: The type or format of the technical resource ID, for example, a phone number or an email address.

marketId.description: The unique identifier of the market.

ratePlanId.description: The unique identifier of the rate plan.

ratePlanDescription.description: The description of the rate plan.

subscriptionParameter.description: Additional attributes that determine provisioning of a subscription.

code.description: The user-defined identifier for the subscription parameter.

coreOnlySingle.description: By default, the `coreOnly` parameter is set to `false`. If you set it to `true`, products will be returned without mixin data (that is, data specific to a particular product type).
coreOnlySingle.name: coreOnly

coreOnlyMultiple.description: By default, the `coreOnly` parameter is set to `true`. If you set it to `false`, products will be returned with mixin data (that is, data specific to a particular product type).
coreOnlyMultiple.name: coreOnly

changedAfter.description: Returns products that were created or changed on or after a specified date, for example, `changedAfter=2017-08-01T04:00:00.000Z`.
changedAfter.name: changedAfter

pageNumber.description:
The page number to be retrieved where the size of the pages must be specified by the pageSize parameter.
The number of the first page is `0`.
pageNumber.name: pageNumber

pageSize.description:
The number of documents retrieved on each page.
For example, `pageNumber=2&pageSize=30` retrieves the third page. The page contains 30 elements. This means that from the total list, you get the elements 61-90.
If you do not provide a page size, the size is set to `100` as a default.
pageSize.name: pageSize

q.description: Returns a list of products containing the product `code`, `name`, or `description` specified in the query string, for example, `q=SAMPLE_PRODUCT`.
q.name: q

published.description: Returns products by product status, for example, `published=true` or `published=false`.
published.name: published

productType.description: Returns products by productType, for example, `productType=subscriptionProduct`.
productType.name: productType

marketId.description: Returns products by activated market, for example, `market=A1`.
marketId.name: market

sortBy.description:
Defines the attributes to be used for sorting the results.
Products can be sorted by `name`, `description`, `code`, `ID`, `createdAt` and `changedAt`.
sortBy.name: sortBy

customReferences.typeCode.description:
Filter products by the identifying typeCode (reference type) of a custom reference, for example, `customReferences.typeCode=VENDOR_ID`. If provided, products that have a custom reference with this type code are returned.
If you search for several type codes, they are combined with a logical **OR**. In that case, all products that contain at least one of the given type codes are returned.
If you search for a combination of several type codes and IDs, the type codes and IDs are combined with a logical **AND**. In that case, all products that contain at least one of the given type codes with one of the given IDs are returned.
customReferences.typeCode.name: customReferences.typeCode

customReferences.id.description:
Filters products by the ID of a custom reference, for example, `customReferences.id=153986` . If provided, products that have a custom reference with this ID are returned.
If you search for several IDs, they are combined with a logical **OR**. In that case, all products that contain at least one of the given IDs are returned.
If you search for a combination of several type codes and IDs, the type codes and IDs are combined with a logical **AND**. In that case, all products that contain at least one of the given type codes with one of the given IDs are returned.
customReferences.id.name: customReferences.id

404.description: The specified product does not exist.

post.description:
Creates a new product.
For information about the applicable constraints and logic, see the API Developer Guide.

400.description:
Your input data is not valid or not in a consistent format. Please check it and try again.
You can also check the response payload for more information.

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: The user-defined identifier of a product, for example, `SAMPLE_PROD`.

404.description: The specified product does not exist.

get.description:
Search for products using different search parameters.
For more information about additional header fields, see the API Developer Guide.

x-count.description: Total number of products that match the search criteria.

get.summary: Retrieves a product with a specific ID.
get.description: Retrieves a single product with a specific identifier.

parameters.name: productId
parameters.description: The technical identifier of a product, for example, `e10fhj99-5a51-419a-btr6-5d37bb2be4ht`.

404.description: The specified product does not exist.

put.summary: Updates a product with a specific ID.
put.description:
Updates a single product with a specific identifier.
For more information about the applicable constraints and logic, see the API Developer Guide.

parameters.name: productId
parameters.description: The technical identifier of a product, for example, `e10fhj99-5a51-419a-btr6-5d37bb2be4ht`.

400.description:
Your input data is not valid or not in a consistent format. Please check it and try again.
You can also check the response payload for more information.

404.description: The specified product does not exist.

409.description: The product could not be updated because the `code` or the `productId` already exists.

412.description: The product could not be updated because it was updated by another user in the meantime.

delete.summary: Deletes a product with a specific ID.
delete.description: Deletes a product with a specific identifier.

parameters.name: productId
parameters.description: The technical identifier of a product, for example, `e10fhj99-5a51-419a-btr6-5d37bb2be4ht`.

404.description: The specified product does not exist.

get.summary: Retrieves the mixin data of a product with a specific ID.
get.description: Retrieves the mixin data of a product with a specific identifier.

parameters.name: mixinId
parameters.description: The identifier of a mixin, for example, `subscriptionProduct`.

parameters.name: productId
parameters.description: The technical identifier of a product, for example, `e10fhj99-5a51-419a-btr6-5d37bb2be4ht`.

404.description: The specified product does not exist or no such `mixinId` is available.

post.summary: Deletes multiple products with specific IDs.
post.description: Deletes multiple products with specific identifiers.

400.description:
Your input data is not valid or not in a consistent format. Please check it and try again.
You can also check the response payload for more information.

post.summary: Retrieves multiple products with specific IDs.
post.description: Retrieves multiple products with specific identifiers.

400.description:
Your input data is not valid or not in a consistent format. Please check it and try again.
You can also check the response payload for more information.

Your input data is not valid or not in a consistent format. Please check it and try again.
You can also check the response payload for more information.

post.summary: Updates multiple products with specific IDs.
post.description: Updates multiple products with specific identifiers.

400.description:

You can also check the response payload for more information.
